meanings.definition: Cry out suddenly, especially in surprise, anger, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She was exclaiming when she saw the cute puppy.
meanings.sent2: He exclaims loudly whenever he is startled.
meanings.sent3: The children were exclaiming with joy as they opened their presents.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to be exclaiming its power with each lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: Her exclaiming voice echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: Utter or declare with a loud voice or vehement outcry.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was exclaiming the instructions to the class.
meanings.sent2: They exclaim their love for each other every day.
meanings.sent3: The chef was exclaiming the deliciousness of his new recipe to the customers.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were exclaiming their demands in unison.
meanings.sent5: His exclaiming speech captivated the audience.
